[BLACK FRIDAY] RamNode – $13.92/year 128MB SSD OpenVZ and more in Atlanta, Seattle, and Amsterdam

amsterdam, atlanda, blackfriday2013, kvm, netherlands, openvz, ramnode.com, seattle, ssd, USA November 29, 2013 @ 1:00 pm, by Maarten Kossen

Nick, from RamNode, sends in a coupon for a massive 42% discount of off all their plans! We’ve listed 10 of their plans below for your convenience.

128MB SVZ v2

  • 128MB RAM
  • 128MB vSwap
  • 1 CPU Core @ 3.3GHz+
  • 10GB SSD Disk space
  • 500GB Bandwidth
  • 1Gbps uplink
  • 1x IPv4 address
  • 16x IPv6 address
  • OpenVZ/SolusVM
  • Coupon: black42
  • $13.92/Year | Order ATL
  • Order SEA | Order AMS
256MB SKVM

  • 256MB RAM
  • 1 CPU Core @ 3.3GHz+
  • 5GB SSD Disk space
  • 1TB Bandwidth
  • 1Gbps uplink
  • 1x IPv4 address
  • 16x IPv6 address
  • KVM/SolusVM
  • Coupon: black42
  • $3.48/Month | Order ATL
  • Order SEA | Order AMS

Atlanta based RamNode LLC have been featured on LowEndBox many times before. RamNode are using Intel Ivy and Sandy Bridge Processors, Samsung, Intel, and Kingston SSDs, WD and Seagate Enterprise HDDs, LSI RAID cards. They recently came first in our 2013 Q3 Top Providers poll.  RamNode offers DDOS protected IPv4 addresses in Seattle. For a list of their OS templates, please check here. All their non-SSD offers are SSD-cached, so they should benefit from the speed of SSD as well. Reviews about RamNode have been very positive and from my own experience I can also tell you these servers are rock-solid! You’re welcome to share your own experiences in the comments.

RamNode accepts payments via PayPal and Stripe. Refunds are offered with 3 days of your first invoice on your first service. Nothing illegal in the US or anything that is disruptive is allowed. Adult content, Tor (Relays only; No exit nodes), IRC and VPN is allowed. TUN/TAP-PPP is available. They offer free cPanel DNS hosting and cPanel/WHM VPS licenses for $13/mo. And a short notice as always: take a look at their Terms of Service and Acceptable Usage Policy before signing up!

Network Information

RamNode own their own IP addresses and have their own ARIN ASN: AS3842 (http://bgp.he.net/AS3842). They have Tinet and nLayer in both US locations (Cogent as well in Atlanta). They have our own rack in Dataplace in The Netherlands.
